column4: I got a nic that is only getting a ip6 address but no ip4 address from the dhcp, any idea why?
it got the ipv6 address before dhcp ran
is the dhcp server working ofr other machines?  did this work at all?
well it won't get an address from the router
all hardware and connections are good
can you assign the ip and such statically and have it work?
loopback has both but the nic does not, could it be a nic driver compatibility issue?
I'd be surprised.  what sort of nic is it?
positive unless if there was more to the ubuntu install than any other linux os?
cnet some generic ne2k compatible nic I believe
according to the network settings it is active
if set to static it takes the ip address but does not go anywhere, no ping out
